title: 107_hr4155
content: The Act may be cited as the "District of Columbia Legislative Autonomy Act of 2002" and eliminates congressional review of newly-passed District laws. The District of Columbia Home Rule Act is amended by removing subsection (c) of section 602 and striking section 604, along with related amendments. The rules of the House of Representatives and the Senate shall be considered as part of each House and can be changed at any time in the same manner as any other rule of the House. SEC. 3. CONFORMING AMENDMENTS. District of Columbia Home Rule Act is amended in various sections by striking certain sentences and redesignating subsections. Section 404(e) is amended by removing a specific provision, and Section 462 is amended by removing subsections and adjusting wording in subsection (a). The District of Columbia Home Rule Act is amended by removing certain sentences and redesignating subsections. Section 472(d) is amended regarding payments not subject to appropriation for revenue anticipation notes. Section 475(e) is also amended in a similar manner. Section 446 does not apply to funds for revenue anticipation notes. Amendments are made to sections 2(b)(1) and 5 of Amendment No. 1 related to initiative and referendum in the District Charter. Amendments are made to Section 16 of the District of Columbia Election Code of 1955, including changes to subsections (j)(2) and (m). Amendments to Section 16 of the District of Columbia Election Code of 1955 include changes to subsections (j)(2) and (m), such as modifying language regarding when an act is held unless specified otherwise. The amendments made by this Act, effective from October 1, 2002, apply to acts of the District of Columbia passed by the Council and signed by the Mayor, vetoed and repassed, allowed to become effective without the Mayor's signature, or ratified by a majority of registered qualified electors.
